title: How to Make Beef Stir Fry Noodles

steps.headline: Prepare the sauce mixture.
steps.description: Whisk the soy sauce, oyster sauce, brown sugar, ginger, garlic, sesame oil, red pepper flakes, and ground black pepper. Set aside for later use.

steps.headline: Boil the udon noodles in a pot of water.
steps.description: Cook according to the package directions. Drain the noodles in a colander once done.

steps.headline: Cook the beef in an iron skillet with the olive oil.
steps.description: Over medium-high heat, fry and cook the beef well until it is no longer pink, taking about 3-4 minutes on both sides.

steps.headline: Stir in the broccoli, carrots, and mushrooms.
steps.description: Mix until well-combined, cooking until tender.

steps.headline: Fold in the noodles and sauce mixture.
steps.description: Mix again until fully combined, stirring for about 2-3 minutes. Shut off the stove.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Scoop a desired amount of beef stir fry in a serving bowl. Garnish with extra red pepper flakes, if desired. Enjoy!

text: Prepare the sauce mixture. Whisk the soy sauce, oyster sauce, brown sugar, ginger, garlic, sesame oil, red pepper flakes, and ground black pepper. Set aside for later use. Boil the udon noodles in a pot of water. Cook according to the package directions. Drain the noodles in a colander once done. Cook the beef in an iron skillet with the olive oil. Over medium-high heat, fry and cook the beef well until it is no longer pink, taking about 3-4 minutes on both sides. Stir in the broccoli, carrots, and mushrooms. Mix until well-combined, cooking until tender. Fold in the noodles and sauce mixture. Mix again until fully combined, stirring for about 2-3 minutes. Shut off the stove. Serve. Scoop a desired amount of beef stir fry in a serving bowl. Garnish with extra red pepper flakes, if desired. Enjoy!
